alert.note: Alert for Otero (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 23 at 8:56PM MDT until further notice by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Colorado... Arkansas River NEAR Avondale affecting Pueblo County. Arkansas River At La Junta affecting Otero County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Colorado... Arkansas River Near Nepesta affecting Pueblo County. .Recent heavy rains combined with high flows from snow melt will cause portions of the Arkansas River to remain above flood stage. For the Lower Arkansas River...including Avondale, Nepesta, Fowler, La Junta...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Arkansas River At La Junta. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Minor Flood. Flood waters threaten Highway 194 east of La Junta. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM MDT Friday the stage was 11.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 PM MDT Friday was 11.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 12.5 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening to 10.0 feet Sunday morning. It will rise above flood stage late Sunday evening to 12.0 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will then fall again but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.7 feet on 05/12/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1000 PM MDT.
